This is my living reading list for 2015. In theory, my goal is to read though one major programing book each month. Of course, I’ll keep reading little books in-between like Getting Things Done by David Allen or whatever Wheel of Time book I happen to be on. The real focus is not to just blow through the books to say that I’ve read them but to go though slowly and take serious notes so I can look back every few months to quickly remember the tiny details that always seem to slip from my mind. Here’s my list:

January

The Pragmatic Programmer: From Journeyman to Master

February

HTTP: The Definitive Guide

March

High Performance Browser Networking

April

Code Complete: A Practical Handbook of Software Construction

May

Clean Code: A Handbook of Agile Software Craftsmanship

June

Programming Collective Intelligence: Building Smart Web 2.0 Applications

July

Machine Learning for Hackers

Augest

Think Stats

September

Data Analysis with Open Source Tools

October

Interactive Data Visualization for the Web

November

Hadoop: The Definitive Guide

December

MapReduce Design Patterns: Building Effective Algorithms and Analytics for Hadoop and Other Systems
